title: Collecting Rainwater from Air Plants
brief: Harvest rainwater trapped in air plants growing on tree branches in tropical areas.
steps: Step 1: Look for large trees in American tropics with air plants growing on branches.
Step 2: Locate air plants with overlapping, thickly growing leaves that form natural cups.
Step 3: Carefully pour water from the leaf cups into your container.
Step 4: Strain the collected water through a cloth to remove insects and debris.
warnings: Always strain the water to remove insects, larvae, and debris that may have accumulated.
Check that the plant leaves don't contain stagnant, foul-smelling water before collecting.
